title: Ticket #3903: Unitialized condor_sockaddr after resuming session.
description:
I found the following security message in the log of this support RUST: 

  09/04/13 02:47:37 (fd:10) (pid:26349) PERMISSION DENIED to unauthenticated@unmapped from host 0 INVALID ADDRESS FAMILY for command 60008 (DC_CHILDALIVE), access level DAEMON: reason: cached result for DAEMON; see first case for the full reason

This seems like it should be impossible. It may also be responsible for the master believing that its children have all died, which causes some disruption to service.
remarks:
2013-Sep-10 11:19:43 by tlmiller:
The full MasterLog is too big to attach, but can be obtained from RUST.

2013-Sep-19 15:45:11 by tlmiller:
It's possible (haven't heard back from the user) that this was caused by the machine in question suspending or hibernating -- by the time the master got around to checking the keep-alive message from the child, the connection had expired.
creator: tlmiller
